= addextra =
 function: '''addextra'''(unit : unitptr, index : integer, text : string);

The '''addextra''' function adds a new string to a unit's extra description list for custom descriptions and keywords.

== Description ==
Adds a new string to a unit's extra description list at the specified index position. This function is used to add custom descriptions, keywords, and other string data to units (players, NPCs, objects, rooms).

== Parameters ==
{| class="wikitable"
! Parameter !! Type !! Description
|-
| unit || unitptr || The unit to add the extra description to
|-
| index || integer || The index position in the extra description list (0-based)
|-
| text || string || The string content to add to the extra description
|}

== Examples ==
=== Basic Description Addition ===
 dilbegin add_player_description();
 code
 {
    addextra(self, 0, "A tall warrior with battle scars.");
    send("Description added to your character.");
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Object Keywords ===
 dilbegin add_weapon_keywords(weapon : unitptr);
 code
 {
    addextra(weapon, 1, "sword blade sharp weapon");
    send("Keywords added to weapon.");
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Room Description ===
 dilbegin customize_room(room : unitptr);
 code
 {
    addextra(room, 0, "A dark, damp cave with echoes of dripping water.");
    send("Room description customized.");
    quit;
 } dilend

=== Multiple Extra Descriptions ===
 dilbegin detailed_item_setup(item : unitptr);
 code
 {
    addextra(item, 0, "A finely crafted longsword with intricate engravings.");
    addextra(item, 1, "longsword sword blade weapon");
    addextra(item, 2, "The blade gleams with an otherworldly light.");
    send("Multiple extra descriptions added to item.");
    quit;
 } dilend

== Usage Notes ==
* The index determines the position in the extra description list
* Use 0 for the main description, higher numbers for additional descriptions
* This function is commonly used for dynamic content creation
* The function handles memory allocation automatically
* Existing extra descriptions at the specified index will be replaced
* Works on all unit types: UNIT_ST_PC, UNIT_ST_NPC, UNIT_ST_OBJ, UNIT_ST_ROOM

== Error Handling ==
The function performs validation:
* '''Unit validation'' - Ensures unit is a valid unit pointer
* '''Index validation'' - Ensures index is a valid integer
* '''Text validation'' - Ensures text is a valid string
* '''Memory allocation'' - Handles memory allocation failures gracefully
